definitions.title: n.[m.]
definitions.body: isolation, separation: Is 27:10 [[עִיר בְּחוּרָה בָּדָד]] the fenced city is isolation, i.e. is solitary (subst. for adj.: Dr:§ 189. 2); more usu. as adv. accus., to signify alone, De 32:12; esp. with vbs. of dwelling, Le 13:46 [[בָּדָד יֵשֵׁב]] he shall dwell alone (lit. in isolation), Je 15:17, La 1:1, La 3:28: fig. of freedom from attack, security De 33:28 (of Isr.), Je 49:31 (Kedar); so [[לְבָדָד]] Nu 23:9 (Isr.) Mic 7:14, Ps 4:9 for thou [[לְבָדָד לָבֶטַח תּוֹשִׁיבֵנִי]] makest me dwell solitarily, in safety (v. De 33:28).
